description:
I have been going here for 10 years now 
There is a reason for that !
Lesley and her team do a fantastic job and we are lucky to have them here on potrero hill
author: James C.

description:
Hazel's put some sort of meat on my tofu melt... As a lifelong vegetarian, that would be frustrating on it own. After the fact I found out that they have done that to one of my friends 3x.

You would expect a restaurant to be a bit careful with a tofu melt to not put meat on it. Its a shame because the previous occasions I had eaten there it was delicious.
author: Doug H.

description:
Hazels is a solid sandwich spot. A potrero institution. Leslie (owner) is awesome and all the people who work there are super nice. Food is good - sandwiches and some burritos / bagels etc 
Everything always very fresh.
author: David G.

description: Thanks Leslie for the offer! I'll make sure to come by and try it again but no worries on the free hook-up. Updating my 3-star to 4 for prompt follow up and great business practice. Will update to 5 after great steak sando ;)
author: Patrick A.

description: Great place with a good and tasty food. However, staff faked my signature and applied their own tip. Not cool, regardless of the amount.
author: Chip S.

description: Closes when they wish, not according to schedule. Previously perfectly fine food. If you close at a different time consider updating your hours.
author: Trent W.

description: Solid sandwiches, breakfast bagels, and breakfast burritos. There's limited seating outside, so take it to go! It's fast and tasty, and the service is incredibly friendly. A Potrero Hill gem.
author: Christina S.

description:
Well, we were in the area for Plow, and after waiting for 1 hour we walked to Hazel's, and boy where we glad we did! 

We had 2 bacon egg and cheese and pancakes.... the sandwiches were perfect.... with a good amount of bacon....and eggs cooked to order, super! 

We also had the pancake...... his exact words, "There are very light" and enjoyed them very much.... "no butter needed".. 

Great job Hazel.... draw back.... seating..... can you create more seating.... then you can have the last star.....
author: Al L.

description:
If you want a fast, tasty, and relatively cheap meal, Hazel's Kitchen delivers. I've loved every new thing that I've tried so far and hope to try everything else one day. Each sandwich is carefully designed for a unique combo of flavors and there are even some customer-submitted sandwich combos you can try.  Compared to the sandwich shop on 3rd, it will be less sub-like but the ingredients come together better. They sometimes toast the meat slightly and it really adds to the sandwich. 

My favorites: 
Chicken pesto: The chicken was a little dry and tough but it was such good blend of ingredients. Melted cheese is also one of my favorite things so this sandwich was a winner. 

Juan's special: sweet, saucy, spicy, bacony, and full of flavor

Breakfast burrito/scramble: lots of flavor, variety of ingredients, slightly juicy, and filling enough for you to not overeat. 

Haley's special: I don't even remember what was in it, I just remember enjoying it a lot

Not so favorites:
Soups: Pretty hearty but not a huge fan of them; tastes a bit out of a can for me

All in all, great vibes from the server and the shop itself.
author: Lydia Z.

description: Very small place, but the sandwiches and breakfast burritos are really enjoyable. Very good place if you want a quick breakfast or a small bite to eat. Nothing is too expensive either.
author: Anmol J.

description: Best. tofu. melt. ever. After reading the 1 star reviews I wanted to try it, and... you cannot go wrong. It is the best in the city.
author: Winter M.

description: Go here and eat the chicken melt on Dutch crunch.  It's kinda like magic.  Simple tasty magic
author: J B.

description:
I ordered bagels through Postmates and not only was it super fast but super fast. 

I ordered the sun-dried tomato bagel. Sounds super simple but it was definitely one of the best spreads I've had in a while. 

I can't wait to try everything else on the menu
author: Tatiana G.

description: Amazing service, ambience, and delicious food! The hospitality was warm and seamless. I can't wait to come back for more beignets
author: Melissa B.

description: This place is amazing. Good food and very welcoming. I would definitely recommend and come again
author: Adena E.

description: The best tuna melt in the city. Quick, simple, and delicious sandwiches. Neighborhood favorite.
author: Jordan D.

description: There for lunch today.  The sandwich I had (turkey/cranberry) was good, but nothing really special.  Service was great.
author: Linda R.

description: Cool place to grab a sandwich or soup to go. I like to drink at blooms across street and when I need to fill my stomach real quick I'll walk over there and grab a turkey sandwich with sourdough bread. It is really good and quick. There isn't much seating so it's a to go spot I would say.
author: Mark P.

description: Delicious cooking at affordable prices. Everything on the menu is great. Highly recommended.
author: Ron B.

description: Great neighborhood spot with tasty sandwiches! Fast, friendly, and a great member of the community. The shop is fairly small on the inside, but they have some outdoor space to eat and chill.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Working at the bottom of Potrero Hill (17th and Missouri), going to Hazel's Kitchen meant going up that big hill. I know, it's only two blocks away, but that hill is just so daunting!

When my coworker discovered this place and told me about it, I was skeptical about going so far for a sandwich. Then, I went. It was definitely worth it! The sandwiches are amazing, a bit on the pricey side, but amazing nonetheless. 

From the outside, it looks super cozy with outdoor seating and a very chill interior. The sandwiches are all made right behind the register, and you rarely have to wait. The line does get long as people from around the area trek here on their lunch breaks.

I always ordered the tuna salad or steak melts. The sandwich is enough to fill you up and still have some food leftover. I definitely miss working near the area.

Food: 9/10
Staff: 9/10
Atmosphere: 9/10
Value: 8/10
Overall: 8.75/10
author: Evan K.

description: It's okay. Small neighborhood joint for breakfast and lunch (only a couple bar stools for sitting) yet they don't have coffee... a handful of vegan options, including tofu in some things. Parker cafe next door has really expensive small coffees.
author: Michelle G.

description: Amazing sandwiches!! I had turkey pesto sandwich and it has been several times that i have tried this place. Each time i had the best sandwich ever. Super fresh super tasty!
author: Evin B.

description: Hazel's is great. Wonderful local spot, quick and delicious. Favorite is the chicken melt, but have enjoyed everything there. Sometimes a crowd around typical weekday lunch hours (12:30ish), but never an issue. Grateful to have a spot like this in Potrero Hill.
author: Wilson L.

description:
The food here is great! Staff was friendly and attentive. It's a very small comforting dinning place and we got there just in time to sit in there. I got the egg scrambler  (asked for egg whites only) they accommodated :) 
My sister got the breakfast burrito, she said it was amazing! My niece got pancakes and eggs, she devoured it in about 5 minutes. My boyfriend got the chicken melt, I had a bit and it was perfect!
author: Solmayra M.

description: Holy cow: best egg scramble, anywhere, and the price is right! Cute, little, hole-in-the-wall place. Cheap, clean, freindly staff. What's not to like?
author: Steven P.

description:
We get Hazels delivered from with Postmates quite often to work and they never fail to impress - very quick delivery too. 

I recommend ordering with a friend and splitting 1x Grilled Chicken & 1x Grilled Steak Melt. Absolutely Delicious. The lunch burrito isn't half bad either.  

Great Work Hazels !
author: Paul B.

description: Had planned to eat at a nearby cafe, but the wait was over an hour and half, so I got searching on Yelp and found this cute little Kitchen. Took a stroll up the road and from the minute I walked in I knew it was going to be so worth it. My partner and I both ordered the Chicken Melt sandwich - super tasty!!! The whole experience was extremely satisfying :)
author: Carol Y.

description: Amazing! Really cute place delicious food. I just got the Caesar salad which doesn't sound exciting but I really was, lots of homemade spices, and the steak on it was great. Outdoor seating with a small indoor counter. Would definitely come back here for a quick or long lunch.
author: Luke K.

description: Hazels makes the best damn breakfast burrito. This isn't a corporate burrito full of cheap fillers like rice and undercooked potatoes. This is the delicious real food breakfast burrito that you would make for yourself if you had the time and energy. Sooooo goooood.
author: Meg G.

description:
We stayed at an airbnb near hazel's kitchen and came here due to the rating. we def did not disappoint.

On a Monday 9am breakfast time, we are a group of 4 and we were able to sit down and had a nice sandwich. Where do I begin? Hazel's kitchen is hipster yet cozy to settle down. Genuine service and fresh ingredients. Wait time wasnt too bad after ordering, I would say maybe 5-10 min. My friend got a smoked salmon sandwich, she received a generous amount of smoked salmon and it was so fresh and so tasty. While we are enjoying our sandwiches, we see customers coming in/calling in and it is obvious that every one just loves this corner sandwich store.

Point to note, Hazel's Kitchen does not serve coffee but if you are craving for one, the store next to it has some really nice coffee.
author: Vivian C.

description: I needed a last minute emergency order to feed 30 people, and Carlos and the whole team were absolute champions. Helped me with all my orders, made excellent suggestions whilst under a time constraint, and were extremely flexible and overall just made it happen! Not to mention, the sandwiches and salads were positively delicious. I will definitely be back.
author: Pearl W.

description: What a neighborhood gem! I usually customize my own bagel so I end up with a breakfast bagel. The people are SO friendly and remember you (assuming you're a local or come often). It's located in such a cute area that you can't go wrong eating here after you grab a coffee from Farley's next door.
author: Cheri C.

description: These sandwiches. What can I say? I think the chicken melt is my favorite sandwich in San Francisco. The place is adorable, and the service is always friendly and fast. And before or after you can enjoy some beautiful Potrero views! Win win.
author: Piper A.

description:
It's a very cozy place with nice outdoor seating. The food is delicious with pretty normal portion sizes and very personable service.

I visited on the weekend for a relaxed breakfast and it really fit the bill!
author: Russell P.

description: Stopped by for breakfast. I got sandwich 5a (avocado, cucumber, sprouts, tomato, garlic hummus) on Dutch crunch bread. It was fresh and absolutely delicious! Definitely a local business to support!
author: Joy L.

description: Caesar salad was deeply disappointing. Came pre-packaged and the dressing was straight out of a bottle and tasted like mayonnaise. "Rare" roast beef sandwich was more like a *grey* roast beef sandwich. Upping from one star because I will admit they're fast...But I'd be happy to wait for better quality food. With so many other options in the area (Plow among them), definitely skip this place!
author: Celie H.

description:
Ordered two office catering orders. One was breakfast burritos and  the other were sandwiches and chips. 

Spoke directly with the owner, orders were ready on time, payment was processed correctly , and both the breakfast burritos and sandwiches were simple yet delicious.
author: Donna H.

description: Lovely staff, amazing food.  Great for brunch on the weekends, very quick service in a beautiful area
author: Sean H.

description: Damn good breakfast scramble, especially for the price. They are super friendly and has a wonderful family feel inside the shop. Would go back. :)
author: Lori T.

description: Just walked by and can't wait to try some of their baked goods. Everything looked so good. Very tiny place
author: Johnny C.

description:
Veggie Melt Gluten Free
so wonderful and delish!
the GF bread is really good soft and crisp at the same time 
and the sandwich has lots of complex flavors
I ate my second half of it 5 hours later (after putting it the fridge)
and it was still wonderful 
I'm so happy we found this place this place
so close to UCSF Mission Bay!
author: Win H.

description:
Went on a limb since we had a snafu down the block.
Sandwiches were built well with right amount of ingredients and fresh. 

It didn't wow me, but I will grab a sandwich from here if I'm in the area. 

I ordered the tuna melt and would definitely order it again.
author: Lyman C.

description: Sometimes everything goes right! My friend and I tried this place for lunch today, for the first time.  The sandwich menu is pretty large plus they have all these specials pinned up on left near the register.  I chose one of the specials: "Ryan's Special."  It was grilled chicken, avocado, bacon and honey mustard with lettuce, tomato, onion, sprouts and cucumbers.  I chose sour dough toast but there were probably 7 bread options.  My friend chose the same sandwich.  Our sandwiches were made very quickly.  There's only a few seats (4?) on a small counter inside but it was a nice day so they had two tables for two set up out front.  We both loved our sandwiches.  In particular the veggies were cold and wet and crunchy and we were both just really into these super fresh sandwiches. They also appear to offer some salads; I'm sure they're great based on the quality of the veggies in our sandwiches.  We will come back here for lunch, for sure, as we only work a few blocks away.
author: Dave M.

description:
I wanna talk about a chicken sandwich.

Well, not just a chicken sandwich.

The Chicken Sandwich. 

Or, really, The Sandwich.

The Sandwich, cleverly disguised as a "Grilled Chicken Melt" is simply the perfect balance of deliciously cooked chicken, tomatoes, greens (cucumber!), onions, pesto, bacon, and of course Hazel's Dressing (a condiment itself that, while deserving of ballads and plays written about it, will not be discussed here). 

The Sandwich is so delicious, so utterly incomparable to anything this mouth has ever tasted that, even though I will visit Hazel's Kitchen multiple times a week during my visits to San Francisco, I cannot compel myself to order any other of the sandwiches on Hazel's wonderful menu. I've certainly been tempted to - many of my co-workers would sing the praises of the other sandwiches.. Yet every time I walk through that adorable looking door, on that adorable looking storefront, the Sandwich calls to me. "Lukas! Lukas! Why would you ever stray from perfection?"

Will I ever be able to order anything other than The Sandwich at Hazel's Kitchen? Perhaps. One cannot ever know what the future may hold. But for now, simply for the matter of simplicity, I'm not sure why I'd even think about it. The Sandwich lives in my hopes and my dreams, and will forever compel me to come back to San Francisco, no matter how pervasive the tech bros become.
author: Luke T.

description: This is a great small neighborhood spot in Potrero Hill serving up amazing sandwiches. I've only been here for breakfast and recommend the smoked salmon bagel with cream cheese or their bacon, egg, cheese croissant. Come here, order a breakfast sandwich, order a cup of coffee from Farley's next door and sit at the parklet and people watch.
author: Cindy A.

description: Stopped by for a quick lunch. The line goes by super fast, and so did my order! I ordered the 1b, Turkey, Swiss, and Pesto, on dutch crunch, and it tasted awesome. Not much inside seating, but there are a few tables outside on the street. Portions were aplenty, and I was able to save my other half of my sandwich for dinner. Quick tip: be sure to check out the specials on the wall because they sound amazing, and I slightly experienced menu remorse as I wish I had ordered the special; one was a turkey, bacon, avocado, and another one was a pastrami and sauerkrat. Ah, but I was also satisifed with my decision. I, for sure, experienced menu overload with the number of appealing options. Just the sandwich was about 9 bucks, and they do have postmates delivery (check out my code 2J8J if you're looking to save up to 10 bucks off delivery for new users of the delivery service, postmates). Overall, another great sandwich spot in SF to add to the many great ones out there in the bay.
author: Kenny L.

description: 1/2 sandwich is more than enough, I got the 5a and added chicken. Fresh veggies!! Really cute outdoor and indoor seating. The woman/ (owner?) at the counter was a sweetheart and let me try the soup of the day. Will be back
author: Zoe D.

description: Very good service, delicious food, wide variety of options, and in a great location. We walked right past this place because there was a long line but after walking a few blocks down we decided to turn around and revisit one of the places we past. When we came back there was no line and we knew we had to stop. Trying to find brunch on a Sunday morning without having to wait in line can be difficult but this place was a hidden gem in my book.
author: Rebecca C.

description: Wish I could eat here everyday!! First, the food is amazing! It was one of the best meals eaten while in San Francisco. You need the Tator tot nachos in your life. Second, service was second to none. We arrived around 1:00 am, but the manager and chef accommodated my request to try something off the dinner menu.  Let's just say, you have to try the oxtail and grits!!! It's so delicious!!! The owner even made sure we made it to our Taxi safely! Loved the experience and would recommend this place to anyone in San Francisco.
author: Marie W.

description:
I felt like taking a long stroll from the east mission over to Potrero for lunch one day and came here on a recommendation from a friend. There was a long line because it was prime lunch hour, but it moved very quickly. 

My coworker and I found two lovely seats on the parklet outside which appears to be shared with the coffee shop next door. I ordered a turkey sandwich with all of the fixings, and added avocado (obviously). The sandwiches are HUGE! I saved half of it and ate it for dinner! I also ordered a side salad. I feel like you never know what to expect with side salads but I was pleasantly surprised with fresh ingredients like strawberries and goat cheese! Goat cheese has to be my number one weakness in life. 

My coworker ordered a hot veggie sandwich that he devoured so quickly I wasn't sure he even tasted it. He also got a side of the heavily loaded cheesy mac n cheese. Delishhhhh. Although this is a little bit of a trek from my office, I will definitely come back sometime when I feel like taking a long lunch... or maybe even on the weekend :) The restaurant itself is extremely small with barely any seating inside, so take it to go or sit outside on the adorable parklet and enjoy the beautiful portero hill while you eat!
author: Mandy A.

description: In a world of over priced toasts, reservations for brunch and absurdly long lines. Hazels offers consistently great food without the pretentious atmosphere. It will always be a staple of Potrero hill.
author: Isaac O.

description: Yummy fresh food. The mushroom bisque was delicious. Would come back just for that. Had the veggie melt and some chips. Recommend. Light, healthy and satisfying.
author: Kristina L.

description: Never disappoints me every time I order Postmates or pick up. My favorite sandwich is the steak sandwich with special sauce. But I also love the chicken and tuna. Fruit and salad is ALWAYS fresh and delicious. Love HAZELS!
author: jasmine d.

description:
How you make a terrible veggie sandwich, well, they figured it out. I don't think I've ever tried to return food but I did here, I wasn't successful either. 44$ worth of inedible food. Not a cheap gamble. Customer service needs a facelift! 

UPDATE: As soon as the owner got wind of this experience she contacted me directly and was very receptive to my feedback. Seeing as how this wasn't my first time to Hazels but it was my only poor experience at Hazels, I'm chalking it up to the staff I dealt with on this day. The owner refunded me in full and was very pleasant and eager to make things right.
author: Ivy L.

description:
BOMB-dot-com. 

I love their tofu melt, and I could eat it over and over. Hazel's is a great neighborhood shop in Potrero Hill. Grab coffee next door at Farley's, eat Hazel's for lunch, stroll up and down 18th street and enjoy the view of the city. 

Only qualm: no seating. But you can sit on the Farley's outdoor benches/tables if you'd like!
author: Lauren L.

description: Perfect tuna melt on gluten free bun. Pickles, tomato, lettuce, cukes and delish tuna salad with melted cheese. Took the sandwich next door to Farley's and enjoyed a coffee and the perfect SFO sun. Very nice staff, too!
author: jana m.

description: Delicious, fresh and fast service. Mediterranean salad, breakfast burrito or any sandwich is sure to please.
author: Melisa K.

description: Great breakfast!! Outdoor seating area small but cozy! Prices very realistic and staff super friendly!!
author: Kristi B.

description:
I came in for a quick bite while running errands. There's a reason this place has a (quick moving) line going out the door. They truly have something for everyone, they were very accomodating of my request to get the lunch burrito without dairy. I got the lunch burrito with tofu and veggies, and it was truly incredible. Maybe my expectations were lower since this place is notorious for their sandwiches, but it blew several burritos I have gotten in Mission out of the water.

A nice stop for lunch and very walkable from most of Potrero Hill. I'll be back!
author: Nathan T.

description:
I'd heard the song countless times. It was on one of my fave childhood albums that I'd play on loop forever. I totally recognized "The Sound of Silence", but I didn't understand any of it since it was a rendition on los sandos hermanos' Spanish iPod.

I feel similarly about my Ruben [sic] Special. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/hazels-kitchen-san-francisco?select=nquritoW6S7otGDH5X6VNg) It had pastrami x sour kraut [sic] x swiss, but it was otherwise a departure that put it on a far branch of the Reuben family tree. The sauerkraut was barely noticeable; any Reuben-ness the sandwich would've had was supplanted by mayo (though the sign had said thousand island) x tomatoes x lettuce x frenetic cucumbers. All in all forgettable among generic sandwiches.

iChoose Your Own Sandventure!
Try an actual Reuben, page 84: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/house-of-bagels-san-francisco?select=Dbvhr2T6vc-_OB7DJEmJLA
Try another non-Reuben, page 306: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/lous-cafe-san-francisco?select=KxAQTGOCcW8oP7CMHLsmcg
author: Dan B.

description:
I'm never disappointed with the food here. The ingredients are always super fresh - Hazel's Chef salad is the best. Staff is helpful and always smiling. 

A great lunch go-to for sure!
author: Liz G.

description: Ordered a lunch burrito with chicken breast, and it was pretty great. There's avocado, beans, and some delicious cheese inside that's all the more amazing because the wrap's been toasted. For $11.75, it might be a little pricier than I was hoping, but it's quite wow and filling. Pictures don't do it justice.
author: Jen A.

description:
I've lived around the corner from Hazel's for more than a year and have never had a bad experience here. Their staff is so friendly & kind and they serve up some seriously delicious stuff, all made right in front of you with real ingredients. 

You can't go wrong with their breakfast burritos, sandwich melts and ginormous salads (it won't leave you hungry!). I especially love their Mediterranean salad which features a generous amount of hummus and goat cheese on top for taste - really great for eating with their complimentary slices of sourdough.

All in all, I'm a YUGE fan.
author: Emily H.

description: Best Grilled Chicken Melt (with bacon YAY) in the city!  Fresh and delicious and that Hazel's pesto spread is Amazing!  Always busy during lunch so call ahead or grab a cup of joe next door at Farley's.
author: Michelle H.

description: Delicious made to order sandwiches.  Get a cup of coffee next door at Farleys and get some work done for 2 hours of free WiFi! Perfect way to spend a Saturday morning.  Ah... zen...
author: Alice W.

description:
The melt sandwiches here are seriously so delicious. They're big and messy and so packed with flavor. 

It's a tiny, neighborhood place, but the service wasn't overtly friendly, but I really have no complaints or problems with how I got my food. 

The toasted bread, and the blend of meats, veggies, and sauces in their sandwiches truly makes this place a hidden gem that you have to visit to understand.
author: Joey S.

description:
This place is pretty good in my book. First things first, their food is great. Get the scramble, its flavorful and delicious.....They also sell fresh squeezed oj and watermelon juice. Yum.

There is also a cute coffee shop next door you can grab your coffee while you wait for your food. If you know the scene here, you know that it takes an hour anywhere to get brunch in the city. But not true at this little gem. If youre hungry and dont want to wait come here...Sometimes there is a short line out the door but dont let that fool you..it moves quick. We never have to wait more then 10 min to order..  

Only down side is there isnt a ton of seating, 2 window seats and some seats outside...but thats never stopped us ;)

4.5 stars.
author: Kristina K.

description: Small place BUT they have some good macaroni and cheese! Nice outside area to eat at close by the water
author: Priscilla S.

description: I love Hazel's salads, sandwiches, and breakfast burritos! It's super easy to order online and pick-up...it's a small space, so I usually take it to go. There can definitely be a line, but ordering ahead of time allows you to skip it!
author: Hayley S.

description: Yum yum and yum. Didn't have time to wait at Plow so walked just up the street and stumbled upon Hazels kitchen. Everything is freshly made and absolutely delish with a great selection from breakfast to lunch items. Check it out!
author: Meagan M.

description: love hazel's!!! love the people working there and how amiable they are. my favorites to order are the hazel's chef salad with chicken, the breakfast burrito with chorizo and their watermelon agua fresca. i live in dogpatch and hazel's is definitely a staple for us just across the 280 bridge.
author: Angela H.

description: Sandwiches are a little expensive, but they are good and well put together.  The staff is nice.
author: Michael E.

description:
The place looks beautiful like a little doll house. I loved the decor. 
The food is overpriced. I ordered 2 egg and cheese sandwiches with crossaint instead of a bagel. They charged me $16. Can you believe that?
There is little place to sit outside.
author: Neha G.

description: My friend and I decided to come here after not wanting to wait 2 hours to eat at Plow, as it was right across the street. I ordered the 5b I believe it was ... The hummus sandwich with balsamic vegetables and it was amazing. Like one of the best sandwiches I have had. They gave a good sized portion as I could only finish half. There's outside seating which is super cute and the people working there were friendly :) also loved the tree of gratefulness outside. Such a super cute idea where people write notes of things they're thankful for and hang it on the tree. will be back!
author: Kathlena H.

description:
I've legitimately never eaten a single bad thing at Hazel's. I work a couple blocks away, and I'm in there very often. 

Sandwiches:
I generally don't eat cheese, beef, or pork, which limits what I'll get in the sandwich department. But they're very cool about subbing something else for the cheese for no charge (avocado, yes please!).

Salads:
I've had a bunch of the salads. The mediterranean one is definitely my favorite. It's gigantic, and the balsamic onions really bring it all together. Highly recommended.

Soups:
Their rotating special is usually pretty solid. However, I usually pass on the veggie chili that they have every day.

Other stuff:
I've never had the melts (see above about cheese), but my coworkers swear by them. They look amazing! I'd also highly recommend the tacos.
author: Shawn L.

description:
Love Hazel's Kitchen!  Used to live right by here so would hit it up every single weekend.  Everything they do is good and fresh.  Super reliable. 

Notes:
- I'd prefer many sandwiches at Hazel's over many sandwiches at Ike's
- Breakfast burrito is amazing.  Greasy.
- Sandwiches are all awesome.  When I want to be healthy I'll get a turkey sandwich on wheat bread and it's great.  When I don't care, I'll get an italian melt which is amazing.
- French toast with fruit is soooo good.  Plow had a huge wait so I just came to Hazel's and got equivalently good french toast.  Actually just took my french toast over to farley's next door and got a glass of milk to go along with it.  They seem to be chill with this.
 - Lunch burrito was the only thing I wasn't crazy about.  Meat was a bit chewy.  Also, the tortilla was like a wheat tortilla or something?  Was expecting flour.  Bit odd.   A rare miss for Hazel's.
author: Casey P.

description: Going to Hazel's Kitchen for breakfast or lunch is the best decision you can make. Their food is so delicious, always.
author: Megan I.

description:
Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had. Everyones tongue is different, but they just get me. chicken melt is the way to go. Full of veggies and pesto solo. All super fresh. Bread is amazing quality, get seeded roll or Dutch crunch.   Veggie melt and steak melt are also just as good. Breakfast is wonderful, from burritos to waffles. Oh my god the salad. Spinach is where its at. Check the picture. Ide eat here every single day if I could. Ide quit my job to work here to learn their secrets.

You must go.
author: Robert P.

description:
I recently moved to SF from the LA area and was so excited to find some new favorite restaurants (on the healthier side of the food scale). Hazel's Kitchen makes my list with the best breakfast burrito I've had in a long time! 
The staff were welcoming and made it very easy to customize my order.
I will definitely be going back for breakfast and can't wait to try their lunch items.
author: Emily S.

description:
This place is take-out only or you can sit outside at the parklet area. 

The Mediterranean salad is THE BOMB.
author: Amy O.

description: What a cute little spot in a charming area of Potrero.  Everyone working here was super friendly and the food came out really quickly even though there was a long line.  I got the Italian Melt and it had a lot of flavor.  I'm curious to come back for breakfast as that looked good too.
author: Blake B.

description:
Best sandos in san francisco without question. The tuna, steak, italian, and chicken melts are to die for. I love the breakfast here aswell. Nothing is greasy and the food is great quality.

Atmosphere is vibrant with decorated trees and outdoor seating, accompanied by fast friendly service.  Vegetarian and gluten-free options as well!

Always worth the drive from Marin
author: Cameron H.

description: Do not get the avocado sandwich, nor the side mixed green salad. Both look weird and messy, do not taste good and are not worth 9 bucks.
author: Valiagd P.

description:
I initially wanted to try Plow for the first time for breakfast but learned that it was closed on the MLK holiday so I happen to take a walk and saw two cops eating at the tiny storefront at Hazel's.

Quickly yelping and seeing the four stars along with two of SF's finest chowing down, I ascertained that this must be a decent place to grab a bite. 

The location is in the middle of the block and has five stools for the counter that faces the sidewalk and what is affectionately known as the Gratitude Tree where customers have the chance to write notes of what they are thankful for and tie it to the tree. There are no tables at this deli/café.

This review is only for their breakfast burrito with chorizo which I thought it was nothing special. The tortilla is lightly grilled which gives it a light crunchy taste. Like many reviewers who ordered this item, the kitchen is indeed generous with the avocado that accompanies the burrito. I wish the chorizo had more kick to it as I added generous dollops of Tapatio sauce.  Price point of $6.95 is what one would expect for this average size burrito.

Three stars for this friendly neighborhood deli/café and 2.5 stars for the burrito.
author: Richard H.

description: You took my order, and asked how my day was. I bluntly said "sh*tty." Your face fell. You brought me my tuna melt in about 30 seconds and said "I really hope things get better for you." You also secretly filled my bag with tootsie rolls. Thank you for making a terrible day better. (Context: Orlando Gay Massacre)
author: Erik W.

description: Best breakfast burrito!  I like them because they are like the ones I make at home. Not too big, quality ingredients, a smile, and a coffee from next door.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Open on New Years day - major bonus points already!

I got a bagel with lox spread on it. Super good price for what you get. Everything is really fresh too. I'm thoroughly impressed. 

Friendly staff as well and they play great music :)
author: Anthea W.

description:
The Breakfast burrito is delicious! 
I ordered it with tofu, had low expectations of eating something (moderately) healthy and tasty, and I was pleasantly surprised (wowed!). 
 The flour tortilla was warm, flakey and soft, but not chewy. The eggs were seasoned and cooked perfectly- fluffy and flavorful. Fresh guac and salsa- I added tapatio bc I love heat in my food. 

Perfect BB! Tasty, filling, healthy. Start your morning right. (And I usually avoid breakfast burritos)
@$7.50 very worth it
author: S R.

description: Good sandwiches.  Great customer service.  A bit pricey, but it IS Potrero Hill.  Skip the chili - even for vegetarian chili, it's awful, but lesson learned.  It's a good spot.  The ingredients are fresh, and it shows.
author: Ken P.

description:
Was originally planning to work at Farley's but walked past this place with a hungry tummy and ... I didn't make it to Farley's. 
The friendly woman at the register listened to my cravings/uncertainty and suggested a half sandwich, half soup. the steak sandwich (melt) was full of perfectly-cooked steak, cucumbers, onions, greens, tomatoes, and melty cheese. Bread roll was perfectly soft and simultaneously crispy, bunch of seeds on the outside, and very flavorful. 
Broccoli cheddar soup was pretty good. I couldn't say it was the best I ever had - that being said... I slurped up every spoon of it quite happily. 
Service was friendly and quick (I went around 1pm) Price pretty good - $10 for half-wich and half-soup. 
Sidewalk seating (table + chair or benches and seats around the trees), parklet area.
author: Menaka M.

description: Love the sandwiches, especially roasted turkey and cranberries.
author: Ralph R.

description:
How have I not rated this yet?! Holy Hazel's! It's amazing. 

I walk in in the mornings and get breakfast burritos or bagels, and the staff is super friendly and fast. The food of course is delicious (I particularly love the chorizo breakfast burrito, but when I'm trying to be good, I'll order a plain bagel with pb&j). 

Some days I'll go for lunch and get the 5A, which is a tasty and fresh veggie sandwich, which I occasionally add bacon to. The dutch crunch role is the bomb dot commmm. I could probably just eat this all day, but I'm glad they throw the healthy stuff on. 

Leslie is one of the nicest ladies I've ever encountered in my life. She knows her customers and treats them well. 

Will keep going back as long as I'm in the Bay!
author: Renee S.

description: Love their food. It is always super fresh and delicious. I'm a big fan of their salads. Hazel's Chef sakad is awesome with the smoked provolone cheese, makes this my go to.
author: Will N.

description: This place was great! I was in town for the weekend and had about an hour to kill before I was heading out and wanted to try something local. Found this place on Yelp and it did not disappoint! I got the sliced steak sandwich and I watched her prepare it in no time. Ate it at one of the little tables right outside and went on my way. I will definitely visit this place again when I'm back in town
author: Stephen C.

description: Excellent breakfast. Very friendly loved the Mediterranean sandwich egg bagel and smoked salmon bagel. A great option when you can't get into prowler
author: Chris B.

description: So great! Their veggie avocado sprouts cucumber and tomato sandwich totally hit the spot. Will definitely be coming here often.
author: Jacklyn L.

description:
The sandwiches are good. But they've screwed up my request for a vegan sandwich 2 times out of 3, even when specifying that vegan means no cheese.

The first time I picked off the feta best I could. Today, it was melted and nothing could be done to extract the cheese. I scrounged at the office for alternate food.
author: Dave C.

description:
You must check this place out!

I thoroughly enjoyed the sliced steak melt. While sitting outside on a sidewalk bench savoring every juicy, dripping, delicious bite, I examined what flavors were tantalizing my tastebuds so that I could perhaps create Hazel's dressing in my own kitchen. I ate the entire sandwich, which is a lot since they deliver a handsome-sized sammy for such a reasonable price. Let's just say, my hunger was happily satiated. :) 

The kitchen itself is really delightful. From the moment I walked in, I was embraced by the salsa music filling the air, the pretty  painted walls & colorful kitchenware, and the smile of the lovely lady taking my order. Oh, and the aroma of what's cooking behind the counter will lure you in, as well. ;)

This place is a five star, hands down. Can't wait to come back when my husband & I visit again.
author: April N.

description: Best sandwiches in the city hands down. Leslie and her team are the greatest people and radiate the friendliest local vibes. Everything is hand made and beautiful. Freshest ingredients and most delightful costumer service. No wonder they've been around almost 25 years!
author: Zoe G.

description: You have to try the Juan Special, the Chipotle sauce gives it a nice kick with some pineapple pieces (not overpowering).  The mushroom bisque is awesome.
author: Pose M.

description: The cutest breakfast and lunch spot in Potrero with a delicious menu and friendly service!
author: Jacq H.

description:
Found Hazel's while wandering Potrero hill with my sister and Mumma. ADORABLE little spot. Kind of reminiscent of Bette's To-Go in Berkeley. 

As SF natives, we can be pretty picky and repetitive, leaning towards our tried and true favorites. However, we were in the neighborhood after shopping for wedding dresses and wanted to try something new (instead of heading down Mission to La Taq). 

The decor is quaint and sweet. The service was extremely friendly. The lady behind the counter (I believe she may have been Hazel) was sweet and courteous. It was a gorgeous day , perfect for sitting outside on a bench . I had a half mediterranean salad with chicken and half soup (vegetable chili) combo. Very reasonably priced for delicious food and it was only $1 extra to add chicken. The chicken was flavorful and the mediterranean salad was divine, with sauteed onions and goat cheese. The soup was  also very yummy. 

My stepmum had a pastrami sandwich, and she gave it top marks, while my sister had a tuna melt that hit the spot.

All in all, the food is wholesome, clean, rustic fare. They know what they are doing here, I loved it. 

We grabbed coffee next door at Farley's and sat happily on a bench in the sunshine while eating. 

Thanks for a great surprise, will come again when in the neighborhood.
author: Molly C.

description: My go to sandwich shop on Portreo Hill. A hefty sandwich, nice folks, and a great view of downtown just a few feet away. Hazel's sauce takes a sandwich to an all new level...just delicious...but it's wet...so it can get sloppy...just ask for less. I order the 5a with whole wheat, Jack cheese, sprouts, hummus, avocado, tomatoes, and sauce...it won't get any better than that!!!
author: Richard B.

description: The gluten-free sandwiches here are phenomenal! I personally love the turkey pesto sandwich and the vegetarian chili!
author: Kimberly M.

description: Order chicken melt with Dutch crunch and your whole life will change. You will become addicted and you will crave it daily. Use caution and devour it.
author: Lief S.

description: If I order a pastrami sandwich I want a decent amount of pastrami on it and not a ton of veggies. What I got was a loaded up veggie sandwich with a single layer of pastrami. If I wanted a veggie sandwich with a tad of pastrami I would of ordered that. Its just not my idea of what a pastrami sandwich is. The people are nice and I have had good food from there in the past but I find it a bit expensive.
author: Tom B.

description: hazel's is great to grab a quick bite when you have no idea what you feel like but want a tasty, dependable meal.  my favorites are the toasted bagel with lox spread, the tuna melt (with that amazing special sauce and balsamic onions!) and their veggie chili.  the husband dreams about their baked tofu melt, we HAVE to eat here at least once a week!
author: Archana P.

description: Well deserved five stars on every level! Great service & delicious food! Menu diversity!
author: Karen G.

description: Got coffee from up the street and then got delicious breakfast here. It's a cute little restaurant and wasn't busy at all. They had delicious gluten free bagels. Love it.
author: Kat S.

description: They use delicious ingredients to make delicious food - I've been happy every time I've been here.
author: Krishna V.

description:
Hazel's is a tiny efficient kitchen. It includes four chairs that you might
sit on after ordering. Coffee shop next door sells the coffee. We split the waffle
while trying to wait for Plow to have two seats for brunch. The waffle wasn't crunchy but was good in it's own way/strawberries on the side plus syrup. Mostly people come in and take away. I am glad Hazel's was open on Sunday. The two seats at Plow weren't going to materialize for another 45 minutes so we moved on.
author: Liz J.

description:
This has turned to my go to quick sandwich place since moving to Potrero. I usually go here for a quick breakfast on the weekends after a run. 

All the condiments are fresh and the variety of sandwiches / burritos is enough to not get bored. 

The smoked salmon bagel sandwich is great. Come with a generous topping of smoked salmon, cream cheese, onions, tomato, lettuce and chives. The whole package is very flavorful. 

There usually is freshly made juice in the morning. The melon juice is my favorite, but it's a little steep at $4+. 

They don't serve coffee, but going next door to Farley's will solve that.
author: Filip M.

description:
I  LOVE LOVE this place. So cute and quirky, more than a bit of 90's kitsch revival flavor. The sandwich combo is the best, and I get the 1/2 grilled chicken with provolone and bacon on a dutch crunch served hot with a small spinach goat cheese salad (for $9.50!! can hardly beat that in this city.). There were strawberries in my salad this time, and you can add things like bacon, nuts, etc. The staff are friendly and make good suggestions on ideal sandwich combos. It's a tiny place but they have a super cute slatted wood patio straddling the sidewalk and street, lots of spacious benches around and a cafe table sprinkled here and there. So, they make it work. And, who doesn't love Potrero Hill? After you eat you can wander down the street to check out the city views. BONUS: They're right next door to Farley's coffee--one of the original hipster coffee joints, and Farley's allows Hazel's food to be consumed on the premises. Oh, yum-yum-YUM!
NOTE: They are open until 4PM most days, so late lunchers this is your SPOT!
author: E L.

description: Great spot for lunch with lots of options. The sandwiches aren't over the top or too simple, they fall smack dab in the middle of the culinary goldilocks zone for sandwiches. Today I had the Reuben sandwich which has a spectacular grilled cheese on one slice.
author: Nicholas M.

description:
Breakfast Burrito review only!  So I had a breakfast burrito urge this morning after a Saturday of SantaConning...  I had a photoshoot at the studio so I had to head towards the Dogpatch and decided to trek up the hill to check out Hazel's.  I love the name Hazel - the only one I know is a cute girl so I was already hoping for the best.  The breakfast burrito here is great b/c it's got no potatoes in it (win!).  I am not a fan of potatoes in most breakfast burritos b/c they seem more like filler and are often mealy and not crisp.  Anyhow, the eggs were super light and fluffy and it comes with avocado.  The cheese was pretty flavorful as well and the tortilla is just perfectly toasty (crunchy on the outside, but not so crunchy that it crumbles apart at each bite).

Oh if only they weren't so far up that damn hill - biking that last stretch is a pain!
author: Gene X.

description:
Growing up with immigrant parents, my usual lunch fare consisted of white rice, some mystery meat, and a sprinkle of aromatic fishy sauce. Oh how I would look over from my lunch table at school and long for what the other kids were having. 

Fast forward to the future and now I don't have to long so much anymore. Here at Hazel's, they serve good ol' American classic sandwiches with tons of other side options to boot. I decided to go with the White Tuna Salad and Cheddar Sandwich with a side of avocado on dark rye bread. The sandwich was huge! Seriously, like the size of Tony Robbins' hands huge! 

Everything was made to order and incredibly fresh; loaded with plenty of lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, and onions. I was a happy camper. The tuna salad was a little one note for my liking, so I plopped myself over to the condiment bar and added some Sriracha hot sauce to the mix. Can't change my Asian taste buds, I guess. 

This establishment is ultra teeny tiny and has a cute, cozy, vintage-y vibe. If I'm ever craving a sangwich again, I wouldn't mind making the trek up to Potrero Hill for Hazel's Kitchen once more. Take that, you fancy little kids at school who ate an abundance of fancy little PB&J sandwiches! Hhmmph!
author: Ann S.

description: I love this place.  The sandwiches are really tasty.  I also enjoy the breakfast burrito.  A definite must try.
author: Raja D.

description:
Love love love the Strip Steak Sandwich! 

The place is very small, no sitting inside but there are a couple tables outside. There is even a urban park that is becoming popular all over the city. 

The strip steak sandwich has bell peppers, onions, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, their special sauce and of course strip steak. Everything tastes fresh and yummy. I got it to go figuring i wouldnt finish it....but it was soOoo good i couldnt stop eating and just ending up finishing all of it!
author: Jean T.

description: I love Hazels. Solid, constant staff. Owner cares. Great product. They always try and make proper food. I've been eating there for a decade. Go there and enjoy.
author: BRADY K.

description:
I'm not really a sandwich fan, but I went with a friend who absolutely loved what she ordered, so this place is bumped up to 4 stars! 

I ordered a sandwich in a box for $7.50, which means you can get any sandwich without bread. I'm trying to cut the carbs here! I ordered the rare roast beef with horseradish mayo and swiss cheese, and it was pretty fresh. 

My friend loved her BLT on white bread. 

Overall, cute store, cute neighborhood, nice people!
author: Jeanette S.

description: I love this place.  Great customer service and an even better sandwich.  Every bite is as good if not better than the last. This is the perfect neighborhood spot.
author: doug c.

description: Went a little out my way for a sandwich ... But very well worth it. Had the special with turkey pesto n bacon with everything on it. Loved it! . I have been to little Lucas in south city and is my go to spot. This place defiantly meets those standards! Awesome, friendly environment and the sandwiches are delicious. Will definitely come again.
author: Lauren F.

description:
The LOGISTICS suck.
(2 stars)

Felt like a drive-by deli. Order food here, order coffee there, pick food up where and when? sit where? Did i order the wrong thing? I don't understand the average 4-star rating for this place. Tempted not to write a review because I have no words for my experience, I'm literally searching for something to say. AH!!! This "confused" person does have something to say. One cook in a tiny kitchen, that's the only thing I couldn't hate on.

- Food, I've had better
- Prices, average
- Service, ? 
- Ambiance, no seating except outside 

After my run Sunday morning, I was craving breakfast. Landed here.

Observation
- no seating inside. 
- No coffee/espresso on the menu? Was suggested I am welcome to order coffee next door. 
- Order my food (no number, no nothing, so how will i know its ready and if that's my order). Get coffee next door at Farley's (i passed). 
-Sit at a (dirty) table leaning on a slope (damn SF hills). 
- Pick up my own food asking "is that my order?" every few minutes. Eat my food in the cold and on a slope. 

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

WATERMELON JUICE (~$2) - it was fresh and I liked it. 

PANCAKES WITH EGG AND BACON ($6.95) - Pancakes were typical. Actually, tasted like air and had to put more syrup then I like to get some kind of flavor. Nothing special about the eggs. Bacon, i love center cut bacon. They served center cut bacon - like 8 pieces of bacon but they were very tiny, fragile, and crispy. Would really amount to 3 full juice bacon in real measurements. yup, one of those rare occasions where I'm consuming meat/pork. I figured the deli was almost like a drive-by window, decided to get my food "to-go" because it'll just be another mess trying to get a to-go box later. all my food was just piled onto each other. Seriously? You couldn't separate them? I had to rearrange my food before eating it. 

MAYBE i should have ordered a sandwich, that's what everyone's yelping about. After my experience, i said to myself "what a waste of a Sunday breakfast. I would have been better off eating at home saving money".

Will I be back? Maybe for glass of watermelon juice.
author: Jane A.

description: Fast, convenient,friendly, neighbor spot for breakfast sandwiches or a quick lunch.  Put your coffee order in at Farley's then grab a bite to eat at Hazel's!
author: Brian G.

description:
I'm lucky enough to work near Hazels, and my co-workers took me there for lunch on my first week. Absolutely lovely place with lovely employees.

Best ceasar dressing I've ever had.

I get the half sandwich and salad. The sandwich is still huge, and the salad is delish.

Hazel is the nicest woman on Earth.
author: Joe H.

description: Found this place while visiting my mom in the hospital down the road! Best BLT + avocado sandwich I've ever had from a sandwich shop! Hazel is super sweet! So happy I found this gem!
author: Alison K.

description:
I have never written a bad review before but today I felt compelled to say something. I came in earlier today at around 2 and the cashier looked up at me and proceeded to talk with a customer, just one other customer while I waited standing silently in front of her hoping she would take my order or at least say help, or acknowledge my presence. Neither of which she did. It was as if I didn't exist to her. Then when another customer entered she greeted them and skipped right over me. I have NEVER dealt with that kind of service in my life. As a current server, I have a higher tolerance for mishaps in the food and beverage industry, as I am in it myself and have been in this world for over a decade. 

The woman in the kitchen making the food however gets 5 stars and I thank you for being attentive and prompt. But to the cashier, I just hope that you could please greet any and all clientele that walks into your establishment and greet them with a warm smile. You never know what kind of day someone is having. And here I was having a great day, visiting from out of town to my old stomping grounds, on a beautiful sunny day in the city I love and call home and I felt very put off by your lack of good service, attentiveness, and kindness. You were however very kind to your regulars who come in which I did note and found that to be wonderful. But please do be aware of each person that walks in as that is food and beverage 101 "greet all guests upon entry into your store". 

Thank you kindly for your time in reading this. I'm sorry to have to give this place one star, but be advised that it is only for that cashier who worked on Nov 16 during the day. And one star is being rather kind of me. 

Take care. You're too cute of an establishment and in too wonderful a location to have bad service.
author: Samantha S.

description:
I've walked by this little spot about 14 times now and it's always grabbed my attention.  Whether it be the friendly people welcoming you inside or the cute store front that captures the heart of every entrepreneur in this big little city.  Hazel's kitchen makes great food too!  I just finished my Tuscan Chicken sandwich on a Dutch Crunch roll and it was superb!  There was a lit of spread on it but this is coming from someone who eats salad without dressing.  Other than that little tidbit the flavors were mouthwatering.  The Tomatoes tasted like Tomatoes and Lettuce tasted like Lettuce, and... you get the point.  Honestly though, everything was FRESH.  The flavors meshed well and I can't wait to head back that direction to check out their morning options.

Go Hazel's!
author: Kevin J.

description:
We have ordered from Hazel's for a bit over 6 months now and about half the time they get the pickup order correct. 

When you ask for wheat bread there is a 80% chance you will get rye bread instead. On pickup orders this is MOST frustrating becuase we don't realize the screw-up till after we've left the store. This has happened so many times that I've just plain given up. 

The other items on the menu are OK - certainly nothing to keep going back to.
author: Aleks G.

description: Great take out breakfast spot- no fuss, accommodating and delicious!   Their breakfast burrito with chorizo is divine.  Love the packets of tapatio as well.  They are a bit on the slow end but what I would expect for a small operation like Hazel's.  Check it out you won't regret it!!
author: N P.

description: phenomenal sandwiches!  Try the Italian melt.  I'll be back
author: Bali M.

description: This is neighborhood goodness at its best. These folks will take care of you like your mom does before sending you off to school. The lunch or breakfast is much better mind you. The breakfast burrito is unique and the sandwiches are fabulous. This is a small place that you come to, grab your food, sit out side, and enjoy the Potrero Hill community.
author: Darin A.

description:
Like so many people, I was utterly charmed by the pastel-diner decor of this little take-out joint.  We ended up with a whole-wheat sandwich with avocado, sprouts, and other yummie veggies and it reminded me of all that I loved about California.

As importantly, it was delivered with obvious joy by an obvious neighborhood loyalist.
author: William B.

description: Very tasty steak melt sandwich on Dutch crunch. Cost $9.50. Extremely fast service (surprisingly so) and highly recommended.
author: Jake N.

description: Made our office a super delicious lunch today!!   They worked hard to create each sandwich and salad special. Fresh ingredients, amazing flavored. Thank you!!!  Everyone loved it!!
author: Lauren S.

description:
This place is super cute. It's a small place with window seating. The window faces the "Thankful Tree", where people have written down what they're grateful for and tie it to the branches. 

I got the cranberry turkey sandwich and a bag of chips. It was pretty expensive for a sandwich, but it was a good size! Delicious too! I'll definitely be back soon.
author: Nikki N.

description:
kind of bumped down to 4.5 stars.
hazel wasn't here today.
same steak melt + italian melt, both on dutch crunch
bottom of sammy was burnt/scorched .. i mean black!

flavors were still good.  would love consistency.  just cause the owner isn't there doesn't mean quality should suffer

let's see what results the 3rd time yields. hopes are high.
author: Tina F.

description:
Had the steak sandwich.  Good sandwich, but minus 1 star as it was a bit too tangy and the bread could have been a bit better.  Good sauce.  Overall, very tasty, but not quite 5 stars.

update:
I wrote the above review after only a few bites of the steak sandwich.  Now that I've finished the sandwich, I have to say that the slight tang to the sandwich actually worked very well.  It was a bit much in the first few bites, but by the end of the sandwich I think that it actually fits very well.  Still 4 out of 5 stars as there are certainly some better sandwiches out there.
author: Andy C.

description: This place rules. Great service. Great Owner. Great Food. I work in the Mission Bay area and this is a go to spot for lunch.
author: Charles C.

description: Yummy sandwiches, cute spot, can easily take your food over to Farley's next door.  So glad to have it in the neighborhood.
author: Chloe B.

description: Awesome chorizo breakfast burrito. They share an outdoor seating area with Farley's next door (also excellent). I couldn't recommend it enough.
author: Matthew D.

description: It's money.  Super melty perfect breakfast burrito.  I'll be back for sure!
author: Jon S.

description: Came here for a casual brunch on a saturday. The line for Plow was around the corner so we opted for a quick an tasty breakfast burrito. It was lightly toasted and delicious. I recommend you upgrade to add bacon. I'll be stopping by again!
author: Michael O.

description:
Review from a regular at Hazel's:
I haven't had anything on Hazel's menu that I didn't like. Having moved to Potrero HIll a few years ago, I try to go to Hazel's as much as possible. 

Here's what I get:
Breakfast: a breakfast burrito with extra cheese and extra crispy bacon. This is the ULTIMATE hangover helper/life saver. 

Lunch: the 1A (turkey + cranberry) on sliced wheat or sourdough (depending on what I'm in the mood for), jack cheese (instead of provolone) and no onions. Delicious!!! The mayo-ish sauce they put on their sandwiches is AMAZING. I even bought a container of it to take camping one weekend! Everyone loved it, of course. It's the perfect compliment to any sando. 

Other awesomeness: the mac-n-cheese, quiches, fruit salad... mmmmm.

The service at Hazel's is perfect - they treat you like family. Leslie, the owner, is a gift to this Universe. The cooks are also some of the most friendly people you'll find on "the Hill". 

The shop itself is small, but adorable. It's meant to be a walk-up shop. Step in, admire the cute decor, order your meal (made with love), and take it next door to Farley's if you want to eat inside at a table, or eat it outside on the cool parklet. Hazel's also just got some new patio furniture for their sidewalk dining. 

Hazel's also CATERS!!! I threw a co-ed babyshower for one of my best friends and hired Hazel's to cater the event. We had a tray of sandwiches (the 1A and veggie), mac-n-cheese, quiches and fruit salad (yes, all the favorites I mentioned above). People were blown away at how good the food was. And Hazel's makes it super easy. I don't hire catering services often, and I was grateful for how easy Hazel's made the process. 

I bring people to Hazel's whenever I get the chance, and they're always thankful!

If you visit Hazel's for the first time, let them know. You'll be back, over and over and over again. Your first experience will be the beginning of a great (and yummy) relationship ;)
author: Kimberly N.

description:
I love Hazels.

I love Hazels so much that I will drive all the way from SF STATE because I am craving their delicious, juicy, generous sandwiches. Not only do I receive a delicious sandwich, but also legendary service. The cooks especially are always sweet and genuinely appreciate the customers.

My favorite: 1A
author: Jennifer C.

description: What a friendly, cute, neighborhood deli! If the home-like vintage decor isn't enough to tickle your fancy, then the food will.  The turkey cranberry sandwich I ordered was to die for, and my boyfriend adored his chicken melt.  We got both on dutch crunch rolls, which were not overly sweet and packed a great crunch.  Portions are huge! Hazel's Kitchen also serve salads, soups and breakfast burritos.  And if that isn't enough, it has gluten free bread too! Space is limited to outdoor seating only, but that won't stop me from frequenting this place even on the coldest of San Francisco days.  Grab a coffee from Farley's next door and enjoy.
author: Roxane W.

description: Adorable spot in Potrero Hill. I got the Ceasar Salad with sliced steak and a side of the Veggie Chili. I went during peak lunch hours and was in and out in less than 5 minutes!I will be going back!
author: Nai M.

description: Big fan of this neighborhood sandwich shop. Portions are huge and people are really nice. Always get the half sandwich and half soup combo with Dutch crunch! Ingredients seem very fresh too
author: Justin Y.

description: This place is so awesome to have in the neighborhood. The food is fantastic, everyone is really friendly. My favorites are the 1a (Turkey, smoked provolone and cranberry sandwich) and the breakfast burrito with bacon. Now they have a really slick app for pickup orders so you don't have to wait in line during peak times. Try it out!
author: Ben R.

description: So happy to support this place. Small, with only a few window bar seats (which I love) but more outside seating. Great customer service, very friendly and welcoming. I've had their egg bacon bagel sammie (perfection) and also got their mediterranean salad with grilled chicken (they have half portions available which I appreciate). Excellent! Great food to grab on the go or enjoy on the spot.
author: Emily W.

description:
Hazel's kitchen saved my life when I was was interning at the SFBG. It was a quick walk from work, and well worth the hills.

Though it's a small storefront, the service is always friendly, the people are lovely, and the baked mac and cheese is beyond compare. All ingredients are fresh and tasty, and it's healthier than your average chain joint (though that's not saying much). 

I do have to say that I was disappointed in the size of their side salads, but as far as SF eats go, it's not terribly expensive and the outdoor patio is a huge plus.

Love love love Hazel's.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I'm fond of Hazel's. I'm here a few times a week, grabbing either breakfast or lunch and an agua fresca if I'm lucky.

That Rare Roast Beef sandwich is a home run, and so is the turkey cranberry. Service is unfailingly sweet. I only wish they didn't close so early so I could occasionally have a sando for dinner.

I find both the parklet and Farley's a little awkward to eat at, so I always take it home or into work.

I would skip the chorizo breakfast burrito (the only 'meh' thing I've had here), but the lox bagel is always fantastic, if a little heavy on the capers. Note that they include cucumber in their lox bagel, despite the menu not pointing this out. I don't get this cucumber thing that California tries to shoehorn into this east-coast classic, but I try to remember to ask that they omit it. Figure I should mention it if you're anything like me.

Mad love for Hazel's!
author: Christina M.

description:
Hazel's is always so amazing. I eat there almost every time I'm in the neighborhood. 

Their breakfast burritos are amazing. And when I'm in the sandwich mood - I get the 1a or 1b...both are amazing. I actually haven't tried any other sandwiches yet because these are so good, but I will soon.
author: Corine W.

description: We originally were headed to Plow for breakfast but the wait time was 45 minutes so we walked back and spotted Hazels Kitchen. I ordered the breakfast burrito and my girlfriend got the Belgian waffle with bacon. The burrito was absolutely delicious the best breakfast burrito I have ever had. The waffles weren't great but we will totally be back to try lunch and get another breakfast burrito.
author: Matthew M.

description: Just amazing wraps! Good value for a quality product!!! The steak wrap is out of this world!! Highly recommend this place!!!
author: chip p.

description:
Shady business practice. Been coming here weekly for years to get lunch for my office. Went one day and spent $100 as usual. When the owner adds up the bill for me she asks if I would like her to add the 10-15% tip. I was confused. She then informs me she usually adds the tip in for orders over $50. Hmmm...that's weird. I usually spend up to $200 here... That really adds up!

"Good to know," I said. 
"Oh.. if we didn't tell you then we probably didn't do it"
"Huh.."
"But you can do whatever you want--here."

Feeling pressured, I tipped 10% and got out of there. I have always given them a nice tip... on top of the tip they give themselves....that I just found out about. What!? To me it doesn't make sense that just because I have a bigger order I would be charged more for it. 

1: This is a deli, not a sit down restaurant where you are waited on. 
2: It is no extra work for them, just more money in their pocket for one transaction.


My supervisor called in to question this after I got back and Leslie denied it. Typical.


No thank you. I will take my business elsewhere, I'm sure one of the many restaurants in the area will appreciate it. Times are tough, and businesses should be glad that people are going there and spending their money despite the ridiculous mark-up prices... not demanding more
author: Kitty B.

description: I go to Hazel's kitchen almost every day. Hands down the best place for a quick brunch in the city. My hidden gem. I take people from out of town there all the time and EVERYONE talks about it when they go back home. This spot is the best. My go-to is the tofu melt on a sesame bun. Mediterranean salad with chicken is what I got today. That one comes in second. Your life is not complete until you have tried this place out. gawd damn.
author: Maxwell A.

description:
I love Hazel's. A tiny little shop in Potrero Hill, this is the place to go for sandwiches. There aren't any tables, but you can go next door, to Farley's, and sit there. Be nice and get a drink there too. 

The sandwiches here are fantastic. They pile them sky high and stuff them with tons of ingredients. I love the BLT. They make the bacon so crispy that it makes a fantastic sound when you bite down. 

My favourite though, are their breakfast burritos, with chorizo. They are a huge mess, but SO worth it. 

The staff here are so friendly, that every time, it's a joy to walk in. 

They take credit cards, but with a $10 minimum.
author: Mariko F.

description: The most yummiest breakfast burrito I've ever had so far. Great place to go to if you want to feel satisfied and full
author: Glenna C.

description: I love Hazel's Kitchen! I eat here at least once a week and it is my go to for food on the weekends. I always order the BLT with Avocado. I don't know what they put in the mayo but it is soooooooo good. Like a little kick to it. The breakfast burrito is fantastic too! Oh and the Chicken sandwich... Everything is great. Service is fast and everyone there is so nice. I'm hooked!
author: Emily S.

description: I had a Chorizo Breakfast burrito and it was AWESOME!  I really loved the food here and wished I could have made it more than the one time I went.  I would highly recommend going here when possible.
author: Denise B.

description:
Hazel's is perfect in a too-small-for-its-own-good-but-small-enough-to-make-it-cute kind of way.  The line out the door isn't necessarily indicative of the place's popularity; if there are more than three people in line, then it's out the door.  But the food is good, and they have good variety for the size of the space and the kitchen.  I only wish you could sit upstairs, although that would require them to make the front door open outward, which is technically the law anyway--hey, how did they get away with that?

Probably the same way they (and seemingly every other business on 18th Street) get away with discriminating against wheelchair users by having a front step.  So I lied; I have two wishes for Hazel's, in this order:  wheelchair accessibility and the ability to enjoy my delish meal upstairs.

You can and should eat at the parklet outside, and Hazel's can and should earn four stars from me.  Just clear up that front-step issue, and four stars it is.  And maybe even five!
author: John S.

description: On our way to the train station and wanted to grab a quick bite to eat. We were looking for a deli/sandwich place that was reasonably priced and we could take on the go since we were in a hurry. The staff was very helpful, quick, and made sure we had what we needed . I had #9 chicken sandwich and thought it tasted great. My sister had turkey with pesto which she thought was tasted great too. I would definitely come back here in the future.
author: Rach R.

description:
I lived on the Hill for about 8 months before we even noticed this spot -- and for the past year and a half I've literally been there once a weekend ever since. The sandwiches are just really good; lots of ingredients, right amount of magic mayo, fresh veggies. You can't make these at home.

My faves are the turkey with cranberry (I've been known to eat them Thanksgiving week) and the avocado-sprouts.  Breakfast egg sammies aren't as strong but the burrito is good.

As has probably been mentioned, you can sit on the sidewalk or eat at Farley's next door.
author: Amy H.

description:
Another Potrero win! This neighborhood has really been surpising me lately.

Hazel's Kitchen is a deli with a great small cottage feel. They use really fresh ingredients and have great sandwich/breakfast burritos combos that are perfect for a pickup-and-go kind of day. You are welcome to eat at Farley's next door which is a cool partnership I would prefer to sit in there actual place. 

A perfect Sunday: It's sunny, I'm wearing a summer dress, I pick up some Hazel's kitchen and have a yummy picnic on the beach.
author: Raina B.

description:
Awesome little lunch shop on Potrero Hill. 

I had their Tuscan Turkey sandwich twice. Its like the best sandwich I've ever eaten. And the staff is really friendly too. 

Try it!
author: Evan A.

description: Stopped here twice and will definitely be back. The vegetarian chili was very good and the grilled vegetarian sandwich was excellent. I also had the cold vegetarian sandwich and it was good. Great little spot to pick up a bite.
author: M G.

description: Good, semi healthy, delicious sammis and breakfast treats at Hazels. I had the grilled chicken pesto sandwich with cucumber, tomatoes, mixed greens with my cant do without sandwich sidekick....BACON! So yummillish. I was gonna order a salad cuz I was feeling like a piggy after Xmas but the sandwich was too tempting and well worth it. I also got a chocolate chip cookie to finish off my low carb diet and it was just alright. Definitely going back for another sandwich sometime soon...maybe veggies only next time.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Three stars is a bit generous, 2 1/2 is more accurate, however.   Good, bad and ugly are:

+

Reasonably priced - can usually leave w breakfast or lunch under 10 bucks

-

Odd compendium of menu items - Mixture of Mexican with pseudo neo deli items.   Seems to unfocused.

Workers do not use gloves or have their hair tied back or covered.  This is just gross and inexcusable in this day and age.  It doesn't take much and it's a good practice,

Food is bland, lifeless and not memorable.   

Too bad...there's a real need to have a decent lunch spot in the area.
author: Todd K.

description: I have their breakfast burrito for breakfast and lunch.  If they were open for dinner you know I'd be doing that too.  It is stuffed with huge pieces of avocado and a salsa that is like crack.  I am not a huge fan of their sandwiches but even if they were amazing I would still get the breakfast burrito every time!   They are super fast, and always so friendly.
author: Joyce W.

description:
I literally just finished my sandwich.....It was so good that I had to write a review! Although my last experience with Hazel's wasn't the best, I decided to give it another try! WOOOOOWWW was that a good decision.

I walk in to Hazel's Kitchen not really knowing what I wanted. I looked at their menu and they have all the generic choices that any sandwich shop has (a veggie, a turkey, a ham...etc.). However, once you look at TODAY'S SPECIALS....thats when the magic happens. They had an array of crazy combinations and mouth watering choices. I ended up choosing a half salad half sandwich deal (because i couldn't make up my mind on either).  

So I ordered the Baked Tofu sandwich with balsamic sauteed onions, red bell peppers, tomatoes, lettuce and pesto Aioli. IT WAS FANTASTIC! I love every bite of it! I literally did not want to stop eating it. I almost took a chunk of my hand off with it on my last bit! My mouth is still watering thinking about it. I'm not even a vegetarian and I enjoyed it!

Next I had the Black bean and corn salad tossed with tomatoes, cilantro, cucumber and red cabbage! Another well executed dish my Hazel's. The vinaigrette does not over power any other the components of the salad, so you get a nice light refreshing bite each time. 

Finally, in every bag they give you a flavored tootsie roll! It is a great end to a GREAT MEAL!! Om nom nom!
author: Katie H.

description: The Lunch Sandwiches are very good.   We have order large quantities for group lunches and the orders have been spot on.   Friendly and helpful staff.  We go back there regularly and would suggest, as one of the better Potrero Hill places for lunch!
author: Capra C.

description: This is a great place to pickup a quality sandwich.  There's no inside seating but you can sit outside on a deck/patio shared with Farley's coffee.  It's also a nice place to go for breakfast because you can order your breakfast burrito (good but a little small).
author: george c.

description: Fresh and delicious sandwiches! I also love the bagel and lox they serve for breakfast. The employees are really friendly and helpful. They don't have seating but you can enjoy your sandwich next door at Farley's.
author: Diana G.

description:
Hazel's fits the bill for a nice big lunch sandwich. Only one veggie option, the #5, but lucky for vegetarians (like me!) it is a delicious sandwich. They also have lots of non-sandwich options, like a veggie quiche, beet salad, and other daily specials (tamale pie last weekend), which I have yet to try but mark my word I will because they look delicious. 

I haven't tried their breakfast fare yet, but it looks quite promising. I saw a waffle prepared for another customer last time I was there that looked scrumptious.

Call ahead and they'll have your sandwich ready for you when you arrive. Glad to have you in the neighborhood Hazel's!
author: anna w.

description:
Cranberry sauce soaking through the paper means one of two things:

- Your sandwich was not assembled very well
- Your sandwich has an epic amount of cranberry sauce

Hazel's outstanding roasted turkey and cranberry sauce on a seeded roll was assembled just fine. They just happen to give you an epic amount of cranberry sauce. Fine by me.

Morning dwellers shouldn't miss the waffle. Berries. Belgium. Brilliant.
author: Jason B.

description: Another place I've been coming to for years and am long overdue to review. This is a neighborhood staple for many folks in my household. We might look in the fridge with a frown, "Nothing to eat. What'll we do?" And next thing we know, we're queueing up at Hazel's for that reliable provision of tasty sandwich and salad combo that has kept the neighborhood happy and fed, watching the dogs wriggle by, saying hi to the neighbors. Good stuff.
author: Jaina D.

description: Wow, spontaneously walked into this place for lunch... What a delight on a cold rainy Sunday!  Great sandwiches (including veggie options), and my chicken breast sandwich had the best aioli.  Lots of kids options as well.  Very minimal interior bar seating (3 seats) but a few tables are available outside.  I will definitely be back!
author: Atul B.

description: Just popped in for a sandwich, CUTE place! Ordered a sandwich was made fresh didn't take long and tasted great.
author: Rondi K.

description:
I love Hazel's! Their menu is pretty big for such a tiny place, and has everything you might want for lunch. The fact that they have gluten-free bagels and bread for their sandwiches is what really wins me over, though. Even in S.F., it's rare that I can enjoy a sandwich or bagel anymore! And they don't skimp on the lox spread. 

The employees are really friendly, and the owner seems like a great neighborhood person as well. I like the community feel of the place (especially the thankfulness tree out front- such a sweet idea!) and I usually stop in about once a week for lunch when I need to get away from work.
author: Brandi C.

description:
Hazel and her sauteed spinach...my heroes!

As a gal on the go it is so refreshing to find a fine food friend that is so:
Healthy and tasty
Affordable
Plus hazels has:
New options (mmm barley salads!) but always old faves like lasagna and quiche

Hazel Will make food special for you, (chicken salad  for lil ol me)
There is a great setup with Farleys, the coffee shop next door, where you can get food to eat there and the staff and hazel clearly have fun and care about their customers.  Oh ya And they give you tootsie tolls...

To the left, to the left.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Yum.  A sandwich and salads you can count on.
Very wholesome. Great people.
author: P G.

description:
Peckish on Portrero Hill?
 
If you put your hands up to your head cuffed like blinders and look straight at this closet of a place on 18th Street between Texas and Missouri, you may think you're in the Hamptons waiting for the Barefoot Contessa to come out in her figure-slimming caftan.
